'''Debbie Davies''' (born August 22, 1952, [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], [[United States]]) is an [[United States|American]] [[blues]] [[guitarist]].

She has been the featured guitarist in several female based bands including Maggie Mayall and the Cadillacs (led by [[John Mayall]]'s wife),<ref name=komara>Komara, Edward M. (ed.) (2006).  ''Encyclopedia of the Blues'', p. 251. Routledge.</ref> and Fingers Taylor and the Ladyfinger Revue (who opened for [[Jimmy Buffett]] during his 1991 tour). Besides her solo work, Davies is best known for her work with [[Albert Collins]] as a member of his band, the Icebreakers, from 1988 to 1991. Over the years she has collaborated with several well-known musicians such as [[Tommy Shannon]] and Chris Layton (aka [[Double Trouble (band)|Double Trouble]]), [[Coco Montoya]], [[J. Geils]] and [[Duke Robillard]]. She continues to record and tour.

==Awards==
Davies won the 1997 [[Blues Music Award|W. C. Handy Award]] for Best Contemporary Female Artist.<ref name=komara/>
and the 2010 Blues Music Award for Best Traditional Female Artist

==Discography==
===Albums===
* 1993 - ''Picture This''
* 1994 - ''Loose Tonight''
* 1997 - ''I Got That Feeling''
* 1998 - ''Round Every Corner''
* 1998 - ''Grand Union''
* 1999 - ''Homesick for the Road''
* 1999 - ''Tales From The Austin Motel''
* 2001 - ''Love The Game''
* 2003 - ''Key To Love''
* 2005 - ''All I Found''
* 2007 - ''Blues Blast''
* 2009 - ''Holdin' Court''
* 2012 - ''After The Fall''

===Compilation albums===
*2002 - ''The Blues: From Yesterday's Masters to Today's Cutting Edge'' [[Shanachie Records|Schanachie]], American Roots Songbook, as licensed to St. Clair Entertainment.  (Debbie Davies: "I Just Want To Make Love To You")
